# The Labyrinth: Part 1?
1
1
BN [Fuji¬π‚Åπ|Moondrop¬π¬≥|Gar‚Å∏]-4 has pinned a message to this channel
DM [BN] BOT 14-02-2024 19:42
On the full moon, there must've been some sort of mystical alignment. A door in the cliff in the mountains on the far side of the lake from Vallaki appeared. Large, double doors made of stone. Each door is easily 10 feet wide and 20 feet tall. Curiosity has gotten the better of you, once you heard about it. What could be behind these doors? Why has no one ever noticed them before? So, an impromptu party forms. You trek out to the cliff face. And it's just a cliff. All this for nothing! Maybe it's time to turn around and go home. . . . . . . . . No, just kidding! The doors are only visible in moonlight! Once night settles, they appear again, large. Massive. The doors are carved with runes. There are three holes in each door, large enough to stick a fist into. One (in each door) is about 3' above the ground. The next about 10 feet above the ground. And the third on each near the top. What do you do? (edited)

Neris [Ricochet] BOT 14-02-2024 20:56
Enter Neris The human woman's boots are muddy from the snow melting. In fact, everything below her knees seems to be splashed with mud. She has a longbow slung around her shoulders and is dressed in practical, earth-toned wool and leather except for a soft, wispy silk cloak draped over her. It's nearly transparent and seems to almost glow silvery pink in the bright moonlight. She stares up at the doors, then tries to peer into the hole near her waist. "Well I'm not about to stick any body parts into that. What d'you think these runes mean? Anyone read....... runes?" She has just enough understanding of magic writing to be a dangerous choice as interpreter.

Torboro BOT 15-02-2024 00:39
The dwarf hadn't been to these mountains yet. But lately, going to Mt. Ghakis had proven more troublesome than it was worth. The mithral veins were scarce, and it was hard work processing enough stone to smelt any usable amounts of the trace element. Torboro didn't mind hard work, but when every few days, hours, even minutes sometimes, he was interrupted by some demonic horror or other, it had become a vicious cycle of mining until he was too injured to fight them off, then returning to town to recuperate, and back to the mountain again, a sisyphean task that never left him feeling like he was any closer to the amounts he needed. However, he had heard there were other mountains, north. If this realm even had a north. Nearer the mists, perhaps he could find a secluded enough workspace that he could get some real work done before he had been accosted near to death... It was to these ends that he had set out from Vallaki. The rumors of such a giant, mysterious set of doors only fueled his haste, and his curiosity. Yes, he would investigate this whatsit, and then he would make camp, and do what dwarves do best. Rock and Stone. ... And so it came to be that the blue dwarf had come past the lake, ready to get a handle on this mystery. He was pleased to see he hadn't been the only capable folk who'd had such an idea, and as he flies in he waves to the folks already gathered around, and takes stock of the door, the holes, the runes, and starts mentally going through the checklist of things to look at. Of course, he isn't exactly wizard-multiclass-compliant, so his mentally isn't as good as others'. Still, he had a knack for worked stone. He looks at those already there, hoping to see someone he knew, and only spotting Laurentina, the one with whom he'd visited the moon. Very dependable lass. But otherwise, unknown factors all. Perfect. He flies in... "Hey there fellas! Glad nobody figured out the doors 'fore I got here!" *He heralds himself as he flies in h

As you get closer to the exit, dust and debris begin to rain down from the ceiling. The tremors grow more intense each room you pass through. A large chunk of stone falls, almost blocking your way! With a final burst of energy, you surge forward, dodging falling debris and leaping over cracks in the floor. As you cross the threshold, the passageway behind you collapses with a deafening roar, sealing off the labyrinth in a cloud of dust and debris. You tumble out into the open air, breathing heavily and covered in grime. The ground continues to rumble beneath you, but for now, you are safe. As you all re-orient yourselves in the "real" world, the eternal hell that is Barovia, the rumbling stops.
